raw_json.html_title: Identify Data Points in Off-Screen R Graphics Devices | R-bloggers
raw_json.main_html:
Identify Data Points in Off-Screen R Graphics Devices

Posted on March 16, 2009 by Yihui Xie in R bloggers | 0 Comments

[This article was first published on Keep on Fighting! » R Language, and kindly contributed to R-bloggers]. (You can report issue about the content on this page here)
Want to share your content on R-bloggers? click here if you have a blog, or here if you don't.

Today Ruya Gokhan Kocer asked me how to use the R function identify() in off-screen graphics devices. Actually it’s pretty easy as long as we obtain the list returned by identify(pos = TRUE). For example,

Downdload the file here 
# open a windows device
x11()
x = rnorm(20)
y = rnorm(20)
plot(x, y)
# identify 5 points
id = identify(x, y, n = 5, pos = TRUE)

# $ind
# [1]  2  6 10 14 16
#
# $pos
# [1] 1 1 4 4 1

# then open a bitmap device
png("identify.png")
plot(x, y)
# use the information from above mouse click
text(x[id$ind], y[id$ind], id$ind, pos = id$pos)
dev.off()
